intro: Tithymalus rechingeri, commonly known as the Rechinger's tithymale, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes with cool, temperate climates. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in a dense cluster, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Tithymalus rechingeri is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to harsh, high-altitude conditions.
